proposals.title: Predicting Total Sales
proposals.description: This AI model will predict the total sales for a given order based on the provided features.  A regression model will be trained on historical order data, learning the relationships between factors like quantity, unit price, and product category to estimate the total sales. This can be used for forecasting future sales and optimizing pricing strategies.
kpis: Improved sales forecasting accuracy: Measured by the Mean Absolute Percentage Error (MAPE) between predicted and actual sales.
Reduced sales variance: Measured by the standard deviation of the difference between predicted and actual sales.
Optimized pricing strategies: Measured by the increase in average revenue per order.
proposals.business_value: Accurate sales prediction enables better inventory management, improved resource allocation, and more effective financial planning.  Optimized pricing strategies can lead to increased profitability.
proposals.prediction_interpretation: The model will output a numerical value representing the predicted total sales for an order. For example, a prediction of 500 means the model estimates the order will generate 500 in revenue.  Predictions can be compared to the actual values to assess model accuracy.
proposals.target variable understanding: TotalSales represents the total revenue generated by a single order.  The number of unique predictions will be high, as TotalSales is a continuous variable influenced by multiple factors.  The range of predictions is expected to reflect the variability in order values.

proposals.title: Regional Sales Forecasting
proposals.description: This use case focuses on predicting the total sales for a specific region. A regression model will be trained to learn the relationship between region and total sales.  This model can assist in allocating resources effectively and setting regional sales targets.
kpis: Accuracy of regional sales forecasts: Measured by the Mean Absolute Error (MAE) between predicted and actual regional sales.
Improved resource allocation: Measured by the efficiency of resource allocation across regions based on predictions.
Attainment of regional sales targets: Measured by the percentage of regional sales targets achieved.
proposals.business_value: Accurate regional sales forecasts enable better resource allocation, targeted marketing campaigns, and improved overall sales performance. Understanding regional sales patterns helps identify opportunities and challenges in different markets.
proposals.prediction_interpretation: The model will output a predicted total sales value for a specific region. A prediction of 10,000 for the 'East' region signifies that the model anticipates 10,000 in sales from that region. The accuracy of these predictions is determined by comparing them to the actual regional sales figures.
proposals.target variable understanding: TotalSales is a continuous variable representing total revenue, here aggregated by region.  The number of unique predictions will be limited by the number of unique regions.  For example, if there are 4 regions, the model will output a prediction for each.

proposals.title: Product Category Sales Segmentation
proposals.description: This use case employs clustering to segment product categories based on their sales patterns. The model will group similar product categories based on features such as total sales and average unit price. This can inform product development, inventory planning, and marketing strategy.
kpis: Distinctness of clusters: Measured by the silhouette score, indicating how well-separated the clusters are.
Cluster interpretability: Assessed by analyzing the characteristics of products within each cluster.
Improved inventory management: Measured by the reduction in inventory holding costs and stockouts.
proposals.business_value: Product category segmentation allows for better understanding of market trends, optimized inventory strategies, and the development of targeted marketing campaigns. This improves efficiency and profitability.
proposals.prediction_interpretation: The model will assign each product category to a cluster.  For example, 'Office Equipment' might be clustered with 'Accessories' if they exhibit similar sales patterns.  These groupings reveal relationships between product categories which can inform strategic decision making.
proposals.target variable understanding: Category is a categorical variable representing the product type.  The number of unique predictions will be equal to the number of clusters the algorithm identifies. Each product category will be assigned to a cluster.

proposals.title: Customer Segmentation Based on Spending
proposals.description: This use case applies clustering to segment customers based on their total spending. The algorithm will group customers with similar spending habits, allowing for targeted marketing efforts and personalized offers.
kpis: Customer segmentation clarity: Measured by the silhouette score, indicating how well-separated the customer segments are.
Effectiveness of targeted marketing: Measured by conversion rates and customer lifetime value within each segment.
Improved customer retention: Measured by the reduction in customer churn rate.
proposals.business_value: Customer segmentation facilitates personalized marketing, improved customer relationships, and increased sales and customer retention.  Targeted campaigns improve ROI on marketing spending.
proposals.prediction_interpretation: The model will assign each customer to a cluster representing their spending behavior. For example, 'CUST-1' might be grouped with other high-spending customers in one cluster, while 'CUST-2' might belong to a lower-spending cluster. These segments help identify key customer groups.
proposals.target variable understanding: CustomerID is a categorical variable uniquely identifying each customer. The number of unique predictions will be equal to the number of clusters identified, representing customer segments.  Each customer will be assigned to a segment.
